threeBrain 0.1.3
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Create a Threejs Brain

threejs_brain.Rd

Create a Threejs Brain

threejs_brain(..., widget_id = "threebrain_data", time_range = NULL,
  value_range = NULL, symmetric = 0, side_camera = FALSE,
  side_camera_zoom = 1, control_panel = TRUE, control_presets = NULL,
  camera_center = c(0, 0, 0), camera_pos = c(0, 0, 500),
  start_zoom = 1, color_ramp = c("navyblue", "#e2e2e2", "red"),
  color_type = "continuous", n_color = 64,
  color_names = seq_along(color_ramp), show_legend = TRUE,
  legend_title = "Value", tmp_dirname = NULL, width = NULL,
  height = NULL, optionals = list(), debug = FALSE, token = NULL,
  coords = NULL, browser_external = TRUE, global_data = list(),
  .list = list())

Arguments

..., .list

geometries inherit from AbstractGeom
widget_id

unique identifier for the widget. Use it when you have multiple widgets in one website (shiny for example)
time_range

used to calculate animation time (not yet implemented)
value_range

used to generate colors
symmetric

default 0, color center will be mapped to this value
side_camera

enable side cameras to view objects from fixed perspective
side_camera_zoom

if side camera is enabled, zoom-in level, from 1 to 5
control_panel

enable control panels for the widget
control_presets

presets to be shown in control panels
camera_center

position where camera should focus at
camera_pos

XYZ position of camera
start_zoom

numeric, positive number indicating start zoom level
color_ramp

used to generate color ramps
color_type

'continuous' or 'discrete'
n_color

how many colors in the color ramp (used by continuous legend)
color_names

color names (used by discrete legend)
show_legend

show legend in control panel?
legend_title

legend title
tmp_dirname

internally used
width, height

width and height of the widget. By default width="100 and height varies.
optionals

internally used
debug

internally used for debugging
token

used to identify widgets in JS localStorage
coords

NULL to hide coordinates or numeric vector of three.
browser_external

use system default browser (default) or builtin one.
global_data

internally use, mainly to store orientation matrices.

Contents

  • Arguments
